title: Traditional ethnic culture thrives in Aba, SW China
content:
An artist (L) carves a stone as a learner looks on at a stone carving park in Rangtang County of Aba Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture, southwest China's Sichuan Province, June 13, 2020. (Xinhua/Shen Bohan)
MAOXIAN, June 24 (Xinhua) -- Located in the northwest of Sichuan Province, with a population of nearly one million, Aba Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture has a diversity of ethnic minority groups, including Tibetan, Qiang and Hui, etc.
In recent years, to better inherit the ethnic culture, local schools have introduced more traditional cultural courses while local authorities set up training workshops about intangible cultural heritage to help villagers learn traditional crafts, also as a way to boost their incomes.
In 2018, the production value of cultural industry in this prefecture has reached about 1.2 billion yuan (about 169.8 million U.S. dollars), accounting for 3.32 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) of this prefecture.
